4. The cycloolefin polymer according to claim 1, wherein the cycloolefin polymer is a polymer, or hydrogenated product thereof, comprising:the structural unit derived from the compound (A); anda structural unit derived from at least one norbornene-based monomer (B) different from the compound (A).

5. The cycloolefin polymer according to claim 4,wherein the norbornene-based monomer (B) is:(i) a norbornene that is unsubstituted or has an alkyl group, an alkenyl group, an aromatic ring group, an oxygen atom-containing polar group, or a nitrogen atom-containing polar group as a substituent;(ii) a monomer indicated by following formula (3):

whereR1b and R2b each independently represent a hydrogen atom; a halogen atom; a hydrocarbon group having a carbon number of 1 to 20 and optionally having a substitutent; or an organic group comprising a silicon atom, an oxygen atom or a nitrogen atom,R1b and R2b are optionally bonded to each other to form a ring, andR3b is a divalent hydrocarbon group having a carbon number of 1 to 20 and optionally having a substituent; or(iii) a monomer indicated by following formula (4):

whereR4b to R7b each independently represent a hydrogen atom; a halogen atom; a hydrocarbon group having a carbon number of 1 to 20 and optionally having a substituent; or an organic group comprising a silicon atom, an oxygen atom or a nitrogen atom,R4b and R6b are optionally bonded to each other to form a ring, andm is 1 or 2.
6. The cycloolefin polymer according to claim 1, having a weight-average molecular weight of not less than 20,000 and not more than 40,000.
7. The cycloolefin polymer according to claim 1, having a refractive index of not less than 1.545.

8. A method for producing a cycloolefin polymer, comprising performing a polymerization of a naphthyl group-containing alicyclic compound (A) represented by following formula (1) or a polymer comprising a structural unit derived from the compound (A):

where one of R2a to R5a is a naphthyl group and remaining groups among R2a to R5a and R1 are each independently:(i) a hydrogen atom;(ii) a halogen atom; or(iii) a substituted or unsubstituted hydrocarbon group having a carbon number of 1 to 30 and optionally having a linking group comprising an oxygen atom, a nitrogen atom, a sulfur atom or a silicon atom, except for the hydrocarbon group comprising an aromatic ring,wherein a proportion of a total number of moles of the compound (A) and the structural unit derived from the compound (A) relative to a total number of moles of all monomers and structural units in a feedstock for polymerization is not less than 20 mol % and not more than 100 mol %.

9. The method according to claim 8, comprising performing a polymerization of:a feedstock for polymerization comprising:the compound (A) or a polymer comprising a structural unit derived from the compound (A); andat least one norbornene-based monomer (B) different from the naphthyl group-containing alicyclic compound (A) or a polymer comprising a structural unit derived from the norbornene-based monomer (B); ora feedstock for polymerization comprising a polymer comprising a structural unit derived from the compound (A) and a structural unit derived from the norbornene-based monomer (B).

10. The method according to claim 8, whereinthe polymerization is performed in the presence of a metathesis polymerization catalyst, andthe metathesis polymerization catalyst is a transition metal imide complex represented by formula (1):
M(NRa)X4-p(ORb)p. Lq (1)

whereM is a metal atom selected from transition metal atoms of group 6 of the periodic table,Ra is a phenyl group optionally having a substituent at at least one position of positions 3, 4 and 5 or a group represented by —CH2Rc, where Rc is a hydrogen atom, an alkyl group optionally having a substituent, or an aryl group optionally having a substituent,Rb is an alkyl group optionally having a substituent or an aryl group optionally having a substituent,X is a halogen atom, an alkyl group, an aryl group, an aralkyl group or an alkylsilyl group,L is an electron donating neutral ligand,p is 0 or 1,q is an integer of 0 to 2,each X's may be the same or different if a plurality of X's are present, and each L's may be the same or different if a plurality of L's are present.
11. The method according to claim 8, further comprising hydrogenating a polymer obtained by the polymerization.
12. An optical element comprising the cycloolefin polymer according to claim 1.
